intro: Altensteinia inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal altensteinia, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Altensteiniaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, with leaves that vary in shape and size along the stem, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in temperate regions with high humidity. Its reproductive structures are specialized, featuring small, clustered spores that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Altensteinia inaequalis is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
